result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chrystopher R Pugh

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chrystopher R Pugh in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Chrystopher R Pugh.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court orders the stayed warranted to be canceled. Defendant has completed the essay and the drivers safety course. Defendant needs to complete 20 hours of community service. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Chrystopher R Pugh not in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Chrystopher R Pugh.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant does not appear.  Defense request Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.
Review hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Driver's Safety Course Completion Certificate
Received and Filed: Essay from Defendant

Defendant Chrystopher R Pugh in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Deferred prosecution agreement hearing.  
Sworn: Chrystopher Pugh.  The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Davis, Branch 21 for a review hearing.
 Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights/ Addendum   Received and Filed.

Defendant Chrystopher R Pugh in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a DPA hearing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Chrystopher R Pugh in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Chrystopher R Pugh appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case adjourned to branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chrystopher R Pugh in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Brown Deer Police Sgt D. Tucek. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
No driving without a valid license.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 03/20/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Chrystopher R Pugh in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/18/22 @ 2:30p
